page.title: 11HACKLINGE AREA EDUCATION
page.content: {Education. There are no schools in the region. There is a Playgroup in Worth for children of pre-school age. The child- ren between 5 and 11 in the northern half of the grid go to Worth School and those in the southern half to Mongeham or Northbourne. Older child- ren attend Sandwich Secondary School or Manwood's Grammar in Sandwich. Most young children are taken to school by private car, older ones usually cycle. {Media. Television is watched by everybody, few families have videos. Most people listen to radio. Local stations are Radio Invicta and Radio Kent. Radio 2 and 4 broadcast by the B.B.C. are the most popular. Newspapers are delivered everywhere. The local paper is The East Kent Mercury. Adscene is a free paper.
